Text: Thank you for calling Comcast, Salus, and how can I help you?
I'm calling because Comcast has raised my rates again.
I don't understand why I have to pay more for the same services.
Can you tell me where this $4 is coming from?
I'm going to definitely take a look at it.
Can I just make sure that I have the right account up?
Can I get you to verify your name and your address?
It's Sally Walton, 1, 2, 5, 5 East Kentucky Avenue, Thornton, Colorado, 8, 0, 2, 2, 9.
I'm going to go ahead and pull up your last statement so we can review it together and see where that extra $4 is coming from.
It just seems like Comcast keeps raising the rates and getting really expensive.
Let's see what's going on with the billing concern.
Looks like your services for your household, you have the preferred packet for the HD box.
And the rate for the HD went from $8 to $10 and the preferred package went from $16.95 to $18.
So it's a difference of $3.50 from your last statement.
Okay, but I just don't understand why it's $3.50 more or $4 for that matter, but none of my services are increasing.
And let me ask you this.
Have you been taking advantage of any of the free content that we offer with our on-demand or our Xfinity.com?
Well, I watch the movies here and there, but that's about it.

Because part of the reason why our rates have increased is because we have all these investments going into these new services so that we can offer our services to you where, when, and how you want them.
Just making it easier for our customers so you can access the entertainment that you want when you want it.
So I am getting more services then.
That's all I was concerned about.
